pullRequest.title: Add optional CI to check if PKI build is broken
pullRequest.bodyText:
This adds an optional CI check that builds JSS and then builds PKI,
installing both sets of RPMs.
Signed-off-by: Alexander Scheel <ascheel@redhat.com>

@SilleBille -- is it possible to execute a PKI job inside this? I'd like to at least spawn a few subsystems, but that requires an init system. Got any thoughts for me?

beforeCommit.message:
Add optional CI to check if PKI is broken

This adds an optional CI check that builds JSS and then builds PKI,
installing both sets of RPMs.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Scheel <ascheel@redhat.com>

afterCommit.message:
Add optional CI to check if PKI is broken

This adds an optional CI check that builds JSS and then builds PKI,
installing both sets of RPMs.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Scheel <ascheel@redhat.com>

nodes.bodyText: I think it should be pki-core instead of pki.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+FROM fedora:latest
+
+# Install generic dependencies to build jss and pki
+RUN true \
+        && dnf update -y --refresh \
+        && dnf install -y dnf-plugins-core gcc make rpm-build \
+        && dnf copr -y enable ${JSS_4_6_REPO:-@pki/master} \
+        && dnf build-dep -y jss pki \

nodes.bodyText: builddep is covered again in line 21 and 22, which will install any missing/updated deps. Do we want to remove this line?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+FROM fedora:latest
+
+# Install generic dependencies to build jss and pki
+RUN true \
+        && dnf update -y --refresh \
+        && dnf install -y dnf-plugins-core gcc make rpm-build \
+        && dnf copr -y enable ${JSS_4_6_REPO:-@pki/master} \
+        && dnf build-dep -y jss pki-core \
